title: 820-00431-a locks after icloud removal
message:
I have an 820-00431-a that wont boot macos after cleaning icloud from firmware.
Will boot fine on a windows install but on macos it locks at loading bar.
I tried several different bins from various places, cleared pram every time, same issue. 
I made the mistake of not clearing the original file and just loading one I downloaded.
You guys have any experience with this?

title: 820-00431-a locks after icloud removal
message: Are you talking about a firmware password or actual iCloud?

title: 820-00431-a locks after icloud removal
message: Also, can you boot to a macOS install USB?

title: 820-00431-a locks after icloud removal
message:
You messed up the ME region...
Clean it with Medusa programmer, if available.
If not upload somewhere the actual BIOS.
Also post required serial number...

title: 820-00431-a locks after icloud removal
message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 59777, member: 682"]
You messed up the ME region...
Clean it with Medusa programmer, if available.
If not upload somewhere the actual BIOS.
Also post required serial number...
[/QUOTE]
I overwrote the original bios with a file from internet without backing it up. Stupid move, I knew better but was being lazy.
Serial number is c02qq24pgg78
I have files I have tried with a clear ME, they don't work.
This site is telling me the file I am uploading is too large so here is a dropbox link.
Thanks for your help!
[URL unfurl="true"]https://www.dropbox.com/s/45jswneflnkn9se/820-00431.zip?dl=0[/URL]

title: 820-00431-a locks after icloud removal
message:
Do NOT quote an entire post, visible few centimeters above.
Please, maintain forum aesthetic.

Did you get clean ME BIOS files posted on the forum, or somewhere else???
You've uploaded two files; same behaviour with both?

title: 820-00431-a locks after icloud removal
message: I got the files from a different forum. Same behavior from both.

title: 820-00431-a locks after icloud removal
message: Never mind guys, My board ends with a 02, not an A. That's the issue.
